pages.title: Breeding Pairs
pages.text: When two identical letters pair up, the trait is $(o)Purebred$().$(br2)$(li)$(2)Dominant Purebred (AA)$(): Yields a $(2)+10% stat buff$() and makes the gene highly stable.$(li)$(4)Recessive Purebred (aa)$(): Suffers a $(4)-10% stat nerf$() but becomes highly volatile for mutations.$(li)$(e)Stable Hybrid (Aa)$(): Base stats, baseline mutation rate.

pages.title: The Hetero Penalty
pages.text: If a plant inherits two completely different tiers (e.g., $(6)A$() and $(c)B$()), it is $(o)Heterozygous$().$(br2)In this state, the plant is biologically stressed. It suffers a flat $(4)5% stat penalty$() across the board until you breed it back into a stable pair (like $(6)AA$() or $(c)BB$()).$(br2)If the tiers clash, the Dominant letter takes precedence.
